subject: Re: [junit] Digest Number 778
msgSnippet: ... I like the sound of that, and I m greatly looking forward to your expansion on that theme. (You add a lot to this forum, J.B.)
messageBody:
"J. B. Rainsberger" wrote:

> The goal of Programmer Tests is to for the programmer to:
> * have tangible evidence of progress
> * clarify the needs of the design
> * "eat his own dog food" by being forced to
> write client code before writing provider code
> * keep focus on small steps
> * avoid writing too much code in one flow
>
> ...
> I feel appropriately inspired. Let me write the article, then I'll be
> back. :)

I like the sound of that, and I'm greatly looking forward to your
expansion on that theme. (You add a lot to this forum, J.B.)
